.  About a half hour drive outside of New York City, the suburb of

is within driving distance of anything one would ever need.  Growing from a rich history dating back to the Revolutionary War, River Vale was established as a township in 1906. It has continued to grow to the point it is at today, with a population of almost 10,000 people today.

Through River Vale and the nearby local towns, there is plenty to do, eat, and discover about what Bergen County has to offer.

There are three major airports near River Vale, all within an hour's drive from the respective airport. To get from these airports to River Vale, a car rental or hitching a ride from a friend would be necessary. Other options from these airports would include hopping in a taxi cab or bus, or a short train ride from Penn Station.

value: : (973) 961-9600, Newark Airport (located in Newark, NJ) is a large international airport that is the closest to River Vale (about a 45 minute drive).
: (718) 533-3400, LaGuardia Airport is located in Queens, NY, which serves for mostly domestic flights. It is about a 45 minute drive from River Vale.
http://www.panynj.gov/airports/jfk.html John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK)
: (718) 244-4444, JFK an international airport that is located in Queens County, Long Island, NY that is about an hour long drive from River Vale.

has many train lines and stations all throughout the most of Northern New Jersey. Trains are generally available, running from 7AM - 1AM or later every day. Most trains to New Jersey leave from
. To get to River Vale, one would need to take the

train station. However, there are not many available times that the trains run through this station, especially in the afternoon and night, so one could take a train on the busier Main-Bergen County Line to Ridgewood, NJ, about a 20 minute drive to River Vale. All in all, from New York to River Vale it is about a 45 minute train ride and $10 for a one way train ticket.
is New Jersey's public transportation system with 236 different bus routes throughout the state of New Jersey, as well as linking New Jersey to the New York City. From
(Port Authority Train Terminal), the closest a bus can take you to River Vale is to

(another small town bordering River Vale), which would take about an hour and 15 minutes. One way tickets generally cost $5-$10. Buses run on a line by line, day by day basis, so one would need to check online for times.
Since River Vale is a suburban area outside of New York City, to get to River Vale one would need to take a lot of back roads to get in. The closest highways to River Vale are the
to the south.  Locally, NJ routes 4 and 17 are the larger roadways, providing quick access around Bergen County.

The best and easiest way to get around in River Vale and its neighbors would be to drive a car. If one does not own a car when in the area, one could either rent a car or order a taxi. Walking is also always an option - sidewalks on the busier roads help facilitate a pedestrian-friendly environment.  A bicycle would also be a more cost-efficient option to driving, as well as a faster transit than walking.

There are 2 taxi companies located near River Vale, both operate with 24 hour service for local trips or for an airport shittle service. For pricing, both are determined based on the length of the trip in the taxi and the hour of the day.
Being a remote suburb, River Vale and its surrounding towns have a few recreational parks open to the public:

value: content=Paramus and Continental Avenues, River Edge NJ 07661. Van Saun Park, the largest park in the area, provides facilities such as a 1.5 mile trail for running, walking, or hiking, a picnic area, baseball and soccer athletic fields, and much more! Van Saun Park is definitely a great place to spend time with your family, and its only a 15 minute drive from River Vale.

content= Wood Dale Park is a much smaller area than Van Saun, however, their facilities are top of the line. Between the pedestrian path for walking or running, a picnic area, and two tennis courts, Wood Dale Park offers it all. THere is also a great children's playground for the kids. Hillsdale is only a 5 minutes away from River Vale.

, located in the heart of River Vale, is the location of a Revolutionary War surprise attack on September 27, 1778 on a Continental regiment.  Commemorating this historic site are a few plaques detailing the events of the massacre, as well as an American flag.  Having such a large part of American history in such a small town of River Vale is very meaningful and beyond cool!

content=Ice Rink: 639 Broadway, Westwood NJ 07675. This small ice rink is perfect for an afternoon with the kids or even for a children's birthday party. Pricing is $10 for a 2-hour session and $3 for skate rentals.

Montvale Lanes Bowling Alley: 4 West Grand Avenue, Montvale NJ 07645. +1 201 391-3400. Another spot perfect for a children's birthday party or to become a member of a bowling league. There is also a snack bar. Pricing is $4 per game bowled after 5PM, $3 before 5PM.

content= Opens each year on Memorial Day, closes in early September. This swim club is a member-only facility, costing about $500 for a family membership for residents of Hillsdale, and about $900 for out of town residents. Stonybrook has an Olympic sized pool, a children's pool, playgrounds, an athletic field, and a snack bar.
Pascack Movie Theater: 182 Center St, Westwood NJ 07675. +1 201 664-3200. Adult tickets - $9.50, Seniors/Children tickets - $7.

, 1 Garden State Plaza, Paramus NJ 07652. +1 201 843-2121. M-Sa 10AM-9:30PM, Closed Sundays. The Garden State Plaza, or GSP for short, is about a 25 minute drive from River Vale. This mall has it all: a food court and other restaurants (such as

, 700 Paramus Park, Paramus NJ 07652. +1 201 261-6108. M-Sa 10AM-9:30PM, Closed Sundays.  Paramus Park, about a 20 minute drive from River Vale, is the smallest mall in the area.  Paramus Park has a food court,

Shaw's Bookstore: 79 Westwood Ave, Westwood NJ 07675. +1 201 666-4484. Shaw's is a tradition in River Vale's area. Every one knows about it - a small, locally owned small bookstore with excellent service.

There are many food options in River Vale, and in the surrounding towns. Most of the restaurants are very affordable, especially for those in the middle class.  There are, of course, the stereotypical fast food chain restaurants in the area in addition to these locally owned and operated options.

value: address=140 East Ridgewood Ave, Ridgewood NJ 07450
hours=Su-Th 6:30 AM-9 PM, F-Sa 6:30 AM-10 PM

content= The Country Pancake House is most well known for its enormous pancakes, with a large option of toppings. Other breakfast foods, such as french toast, waffles, and eggs, are available here as well. The Country Pancake House also boasts a large menu of homemade mixed fruit juices and slushies.
, +1 201 666-9896; 425 Broadway, Westwood NJ 07675.  Goldberg's has some of the better bagels in the area, and all of the standard toppings are available.  Pricing from $5 for breakfast.
content= Ronnie's is known in the area as having the best bagels in the area. If you are getting breakfast, this would be the place. Pricing from $5.

- +1 201 391-4242; 125 Kinderkamack Rd, Park Ridge NJ 07656. New Jersey is very well known for its superb diners, and The Ridge is at the top of the line. Fresh off a new renovation, this establishment is the best diner in the area, offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner options. It is also open 24 hours on the weekends. Pricing from $7-10.
content= Bensi offers a large menu of fine classic Italian food options. Pricing from $15-20.
address=42 Kinderkamack Rd, Woodcliff Lake NJ 07677
hours=M-Th 11:30 AM-10 PM, F-Sa 11:30 AM-11 PM, Su 11 AM-10 PM
content= Blue Moon bosts a menu of Mexican cuisine.

- +1 201 664-7766; 663-D Westwood Ave, River Vale NJ 07675. China Pavilion is your stereotypical small local Chinese restaurant, usually more of a pick-up option as opposed to a sit down establishment. Pricing from $5-10.

- +1 201 664-4619; 72 River Vale Rd, River Vale NJ 07675. M-F 6:30 AM-6 PM, Sa 7 AM-5 PM, Su 7 AM-2 PM. The Country Store, open since 1920, is a family owned and operated small store, offering delicious made-to-order subs and sandwiches, as well as many snacks and drinks. Prices from $7-10 for sandwiches.
hours=M-Sa 11 AM-11 PM, Su 12 PM-9 PM
content= Crecco's Cafe offers delicious pizza and pasta options, as well as great large salads. You can either eat in the restaurant, or take advantage of their delivery services.
content= The Iron Horse is a great family style restaurant with most generic food options.
address=Kinderkamack Rd & Grand Ave, Montvale NJ 07645
hours=M-F 11 AM-10 PM, Sa-Su 11 AM-1 AM

content= Davey's Pub is a family oriented establishment, with an Irish style pub feeling. Food options range from sandwiches to hamburgers to salads - you can get whatever you are in the mood for. Davey's also doubles as a bar in the later hours of the night, so if you feel like watching an important sports game or just hanging out with some friends late night, this is a great option.

content= Open 7 days a week for Lunch and Dinner. Francesca's offers many different specialty pizzas, as well as many traditional Italian heroes and other dinner entrees. BYOB if you plan on eating in the dining room. Pricing from $17 for a pizza pie, and from $7-15 for dinner entrees.

- +1 201 930-9188; 14B Chestnut Ridge Rd, Montvale NJ 07645. Gen offers some of the best sushi in the area. In addition to the wonderful sushi selection, Gen offers a fantastic hibachi meal, and many classic chinese dishes. Also, Gen has a small but tasteful amount of ice cream selections for dessert. Pricing here, as is most sushi and hibachi, from $20.

- +1 201 666-8508; 301 Center Ave, Westwood NJ 07675. Hanami offers sushi, chinese food, and japanese food.  Eat in for a nice family meal, or get their delivery option if you want to spend the evening at home. Pricing from $20.
address=151 Kinderkamack Road, Park Ridge NJ 07656

content= The Park Steakhouse is one of the more higher scale restaurants in the area. Usually, a reservation is needed for dinner. They have many grilled steak and fish options, with the pricing from $30 for dinner.
content= Conrad's make all homemade chocolate and candy treats - simply delicious.
- +1 201 391-3684; 125 Chestnut Ridge Rd, Montvale NJ 07645. One of the oldest Dairy Queen's in the country, this establishment serves some delicious ice cream and other treats.
address=136 N. Middletown Rd, Pearl River NY 10965

content= Just over the New Jersey-New York boarder (about a 10 minute drive) is King Kone, which serves some very high quality soft serve ice cream. It is only open during the spring and summer months, however.

The local drinking scene in River Vale and its neighboring towns is, for lack of a better word, bleak.  There is always the option of taking a train or a bus in to New York City ("The City"), where one can indulge themselves in the many bars and night dance clubs that are in New York.

There is, however, one local drinking hole that many 21 years old enjoy to frequent, called

. In addition to being a bar, The Cornerstone doubles as a restaurant for lunch and dinner. On occasion, The Cornerstone has live bands and/or DJs perform in the nighttime, as well as other special promotional events. +1 201 666-8688; 84 Broadway, Hillsdale NJ 07642.
There are not many hotel accommodations in River Vale and its surrounding areas, as the majority of the area is residential. However, the closest hotels are within a 10 minute drive of River Vale:
